title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 10) (Days not to be treated 
as days of unemployment) Regulations 2023. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2023 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2023. 

Days not to be treated as days of unemployment

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
heading: 2. Article 44(1)(b)(iii) (inserted by article 2 of the Social Welfare
text_raw:
2. Article 44(1)(b)(iii) (inserted by article 2 of the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 8) (Days not 
to be treated as days of unemployment) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 362 of 
2023)) of the Social Welfare Consolidated Claims Payments and Control 
Regulations 2007 is amended by the substitution of “of 13 weeks, which can be 
extended by a further period not exceeding 13 weeks by the Minister.” for “not 
exceeding 13 weeks.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 October, 2023. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 27th October, 2023.

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Section 62(9) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 provides that the 
Minister may make Regulations prescribing circumstances whereby certain 
work type situations are, or are not, to be treated for the purposes of 
jobseeker’s benefit as days of unemployment or of incapacity for work. 

Article 44(1)(b) of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and 
Control) Regulations 2007 specifies certain work type situations which despite 
being analogous to employment may allow a person to qualify for jobseeker’s 
benefit. In other words, the person is treated as unemployed. 

(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
The Social Welfare 
(Amendment) (No. 8) (Days not to be treated as days of unemployment) 
Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 362 of 2023) amended article 44 to add another 
work type situation whereby a person may qualify for jobseeker’s benefit. This 
is the situation where, under an agreement sponsored by the Workplace 
Relations Commission or Labour Court, that person is retained without any 
undertaking of work for that person in their occupation, and that person’s 
income from that retention of employment does not exceed €144 a week for a 
period of 13 weeks. 

These regulations extend this period for another 13 weeks.
